Start to read everything you can get your hands on, and stick with what resonates with you. Recovery in any process means consistent learning. Try meditation, and living healthily in the moment. As for your boyfriend being defensive, you may have to engage in marriage counseling. His being defensive is going to sabotage your recovery, and that's not okay. If he can't start fresh, and live in the moment, he may not be the guy that you need. No one can erase the past, we can only learn from it.

abuse is abuse and if this post was a guy hitting his gf and saying mean things to her the responses would be plenty.  having a mental illness is not a license to hurt people.  if you are not taking the medication you should be taking how do you expect to feel any better???  please, there is NO shame in having bi polar.  do you know how many people have that???  about 1 in 6.  if you had cancer you would do your treatments, if you had diabetes you would take insulin, what makes mental illness any different??  if you are taking medication you still need therapy to learn coping skills.  abusing someone is never okay.. never.
